etymology.description: 十(十) (shí, 'ten') + 冂(冂) (jiōng, 'open country') + 丨(丨) (gǔn, 'vertical line') + 𠂇 (jiǎn, 'cover') = banner depicted over the open country -> indicates direction 'south'
etymology.interpretation: 南(nán, 'south') combines components like 十(十) (shí, 'ten'), 冂(冂) (jiōng, 'open country'), and others to form a visual representation of a banner over open country, associating the idea with the concept of direction, specifically south.

examples.chinese: 他住在城市南部(他住在城市南部)，气候温暖宜人(氣候溫暖宜人)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhù zài chéngshì nánbù, qìhòu wēnnuǎn yírén.
examples.english: He lives in the southern part of the city, where the climate is pleasantly warm.

examples.chinese: 我们沿着南海岸旅行(我們沿著南海岸旅行)，欣赏蔚蓝海景(欣賞蔚藍海景)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yánzhe nánhǎi'àn lǚxíng, xīnshǎng wèilán hǎijǐng.
examples.english: We travel along the southern coast, admiring the deep blue sea view.

examples.chinese: 从北向南走(從北向南走)，能感受到季节的变换(能感受到季節的變換)。
examples.pinyin: Cóng běi xiàng nán zǒu, néng gǎnshòu dào jìjié de biànhuàn.
examples.english: Walking from north to south, you can feel the changes of the seasons.
